Subject. page 1 Press ........................ 301False reports of events in Scandinavia.2 The Western Front ... ............... 301Action if Holland or Belgium is invaded.3 Operation " Rupert" ............... 301 1. The First Lord of the Ad?niralty referred to statements made at that morning's meeting of the War Cabinet as to thefalse reports which had appeared in the Press on the previous day that British troops had recaptured Bergen and Trondhjem.He was informed that the enquiries made of the Admiralty hadnot, as was alleged, been answered merely by a statement thatthese reports could not be confirmed. On the contrary, thoseconsulted had stated categorically that the reports were withoutfoundation. While it would be undesirable to institute a public-enquiry, he thought that the matter should be fully examined, andthe Press representatives confronted with the real facts. TheAdmiralty would afford all facilities for this to be done.The War Cabinet Invited the Minister of Information to arrange for thismatter to be examined.The western front.Action if holland or belgium is invaded.(previous reference:W.M. (40) 89thConclusions,Minute 8.)2. The War Cabinet had before them a Memorandum by theChairman of the Military Co-ordination Committee covering aReport by the Chiefs of Staff as to the action to be taken if Germanyinvades Holland or Belgium (W.P. (40) 126).A report of the discussion and of the conclusions reached is recorded in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.Operation" Rupert."(previous reference:W.M. (40) 89thConclusions,Minute 3.)3.
